summary.para: A subclass specialized for downloading audio data for use as objects.

DownloadHandlerAudioClip stores received data in a pre-allocated Unity object. It is optimized for downloading audio data from Web servers, and may perform audio data decompression and decoding on a worker thread. For use cases where you wish to download an audio clip via HTTP and use it as an within Unity, usage of this class is strongly recommended.
A specialized for creating out of downloaded bytes.
This class is only available on platforms that support .

member.name: T:UnityEngine.Networking.UnityWebRequestMultimedia
member.summary: Helpers for downloading multimedia files using .

summary.para: Returns the downloaded , or null. (Read Only)

This property returns an object. If Unity was unable to decode the downloaded data, or has not yet finished decompressing/decoding the downloaded data, this property will return null. If all data has not yet been downloaded, accessing this property will throw an InvalidOperationException. Note: This property will return a reference to the same object on every call. Accessing this property causes no additional memory allocation.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.Networking.UnityWebRequestMultimedia.GetAudioClip(System.String,UnityEngine.AudioType)

summary.para: Create a to download an audio clip via HTTP GET and create an based on the retrieved data.

This method creates a and sets the target URL to the string uri argument. This method sets no other flags or custom headers. This method attaches a object to the . is a specialized . It is optimized for storing data which is to be used as an audio clip in the Unity Engine. Using this class significantly reduces memory reallocation compared to downloading raw bytes and creating an audio clip manually in script. This method attaches no to the .

member.param: The URI of the audio clip to download.
The type of audio encoding for the downloaded audio clip. See .
